title: Unique existence: the unique existential quantifier

blocks.name: weu
blocks.content: Extend wff definition to include the unique existential quantifier ("there exists a unique ` x ` such that ` ph ` ").
blocks.origin: prop wff weu(setvar s0, wff w0) { ∃!(s0, w0) }

blocks.name: diff.weu.s
diff.weu.c
diff.weu.w
df-eu
blocks.content: Define the existential uniqueness quantifier. This expresses unique existence, or existential uniqueness, which is the conjunction of existence ( ~ df-ex ) and uniqueness ( ~ df-mo ). The expression ` E! x ph ` is read "there exists exactly one ` x ` such that ` ph ` " or "there exists a unique ` x ` such that ` ph ` ". This is also called the "uniqueness quantifier" but that expression is also used for the at-most-one quantifier ~ df-mo , therefore we avoid that ambiguous name. Definition 10.1 of [BellMachover] p. 97; also Definition *14.02 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 175. Other possible definitions are given by ~ eu1 , ~ eu2 , ~ eu3v , and ~ eu6 . As for double unique existence, beware that the expression ` E! x E! y ph ` means "there exists a unique ` x ` such that there exists a unique ` y ` such that ` ph ` " which is a weaker property than "there exists exactly one ` x ` and one ` y ` such that ` ph ` " (see ~ 2eu4 ). (Contributed by NM, 12-Aug-1993.) Make this the definition (which used to be ~ eu6 , while this definition was then proved as ~ dfeu ). (Revised by BJ, 30-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: eu3v
blocks.content: An alternate way to express existential uniqueness. (Contributed by NM, 8-Jul-1994.) Replace a nonfreeness hypothesis with a disjoint variable condition on ` ph ` , ` y ` to reduce axiom usage. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 29-May-2019.)

blocks.name: eujust
blocks.content: Soundness justification theorem for ~ eu6 when this was the definition of the unique existential quantifier (note that ` y ` and ` z ` need not be disjoint, although the weaker theorem with that disjoint variable condition added would be enough to justify the soundness of the definition). See ~ eujustALT for a proof that provides an example of how it can be achieved through the use of ~ dvelim . (Contributed by NM, 11-Mar-2010.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 9-Jul-2011.)

thm eujust(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s2, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  bitri(wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s2, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))), wex(hs0, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  cbvexvw(s0, hs0, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))
  albidv(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  bibi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  equequ2(s0, hs0, s1)
  cbvexvw(hs0, s2, wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  albidv(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s2)), wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))), wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
  bibi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s2)), w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))
  equequ2(hs0, s2, s1)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  diff.wb.s(s0, w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)

  diff.hs0.w(wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  diff.wal.s(s2, s1, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  diff.wb.s(s2, w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s2, cv(s1), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
}

thm eujust(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (∃(s0, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s0)))↔ ∃(s2, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s2))))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  bitri(∃(s0, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s0))), ∃(s2, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s2))), ∃(hs0, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))))
  cbvexvw(s0, hs0, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s0)), ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = hs0)))
  albidv(s1, s0 = hs0, (w0 ↔ s1 = s0), (w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))
  bibi2d(s0 = hs0, w0, s1 = s0, s1 = hs0)
  equequ2(s0, hs0, s1)
  cbvexvw(hs0, s2, ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = hs0)), ∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s2)))
  albidv(s1, hs0 = s2, (w0 ↔ s1 = hs0), (w0 ↔ s1 = s2))
  bibi2d(hs0 = s2, w0, s1 = hs0, s1 = s2)
  equequ2(hs0, s2, s1)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s1, (w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))
  diff.wb.s(s0, w0, s1 = hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.w(∀(s1,(w0 ↔ s1 = s2)))
  diff.wal.s(s2, s1, (w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))
  diff.wb.s(s2, w0, s1 = hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: eu6
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the unique existential quantifier ~ df-eu not using the at-most-one quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 12-Aug-1993.) This used to be the definition of the unique existential quantifier, while ~ df-eu was then proved as ~ dfeu . (Revised by BJ, 30-Sep-2022.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 3-Jan-2023.)

  |- wb(weu(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)

blocks.content: Existential uniqueness implies uniqueness. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: eumoi
blocks.content: Uniqueness inferred from existential uniqueness. (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-1995.)

blocks.name: exmoeub
blocks.content: Existence implies that uniqueness is equivalent to unique existence. (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2004.)

blocks.name: exmoeu
blocks.content: Existence is equivalent to uniqueness implying existential uniqueness. (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2004.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 5-Dec-2018.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: moeuex
blocks.content: Uniqueness implies that existence is equivalent to unique existence. (Contributed by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: moeu
blocks.content: Uniqueness is equivalent to existence implying unique existence. Alternate definition of the at-most-one quantifier, in terms of the existential quantifier and the unique existential quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 8-Mar-1995.) This used to be the definition of the at-most-one quantifier, while ~ df-mo was then proved as ~ dfmo . (Revised by BJ, 30-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: eubi
blocks.content: Equivalence theorem for the unique existential quantifier. Theorem *14.271 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 192. (Contributed by Andrew Salmon, 11-Jul-2011.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: eubii
blocks.content: Introduce unique existential quantifier to both sides of an equivalence. (Contributed by NM, 9-Jul-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: eubidv
blocks.content: Formula-building rule for unique existential quantifier (deduction form). (Contributed by NM, 9-Jul-1994.) Reduce axiom dependencies and shorten proof. (Revised by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: eubid
blocks.content: Formula-building rule for the unique existential quantifier (deduction form). (Contributed by NM, 9-Jul-1994.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 19-Feb-2023.)

blocks.name: eubidOLD
blocks.content: Obsolete version of ~ eubid as of 19-Feb-2023. (Contributed by NM, 9-Jul-1994.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: nfeu1
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for uniqueness. See also ~ nfeu1ALT . (Contributed by NM, 9-Jul-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: nfeu1ALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ nfeu1 . This illustrates the systematic way of proving nonfreeness in a defined expression: consider the definiens as a tree whose nodes are its subformulas, and prove by tree-induction nonfreeness of each node, starting from the leaves (generally using ~ nfv or nf* theorems for previously defined expressions) and up to the root. Here, the definiens is a conjunction of two previously defined expressions, which automatically yields the present proof. (Contributed by BJ, 2-Oct-2022.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: nfeud2
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for uniqueness. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 4-Oct-2018.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 14-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: nfeud
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for the unique existential quantifier. Deduction version of ~ nfeu . (Contributed by NM, 15-Feb-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: nfeu
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for the unique existential quantifier. Note that ` x ` and ` y ` need not be disjoint. (Contributed by NM, 8-Mar-1995.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: dfeu
blocks.content: Rederive ~ df-eu from the old definition ~ eu6 . (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-1995.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 25-May-2019.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) Use ~ df-eu instead. (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: dfmo
blocks.content: Rederive ~ df-mo from the old definition ~ moeu . (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 27-May-2019.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) Use ~ df-mo instead. (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wmo(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  3bitri(wmo(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wi(wex(s0, w0), weu(s0, w0)), wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  moeu(s0, w0)
  imbi2i(wex(s0, w0), weu(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  eu6(s0, s1, w0)
  impbii(wi(wex(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  ja(wex(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  19.8ad(s1, wn(wex(s0, w0)), wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  sylbir(wn(wex(s0, w0)), wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wn(w0)))
  alnex(s0, w0)
  alimi(s0, wn(w0), wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  pm2.21(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  eximi(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  alimi(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  biimp(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  com12(wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wex(s0, w0), wex(s1, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  eximdv(s1, wex(s0, w0), wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  exlimi(s0, w0, wi(wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  nfia1(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  syl6ibr(w0, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wa(wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0))))
  ancld(w0, wal(s0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  spsd(s0, w0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  embantd(w0, w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  id(w0)
  com12(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  ax12v(s0, s1, w0)
  albiim(s0, w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  diff.wex.s(s1, s0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: euequ
blocks.content: There exists a unique set equal to a given set. Special case of ~ eueqi proved using only predicate calculus. The proof needs ` y = z ` be free of ` x ` . This is ensured by having ` x ` and ` y ` be distinct. Alternately, a distinctor ` -. A. x x = y ` could have been used instead. See ~ eueq and ~ eueqi for classes. (Contributed by Stefan Allan, 4-Dec-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Sep-2019.) Reduce axiom usage. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 1-Mar-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm euequ(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- weu(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbir2an(weu(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wex(hs0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))))
  ax6ev(s0, s1)
  eximii(hs0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  ax6ev(hs0, s1)
  alrimiv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  equeuclr(hs0, s1, s0)
  eu3v(s0, hs0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm euequ(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  ⊢ ∃!(s0, s0 = s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbir2an(∃!(s0, s0 = s1), ∃(s0, s0 = s1), ∃(hs0, ∀(s0,(s0 = s1 → s0 = hs0))))
  ax6ev(s0, s1)
  eximii(hs0, ∀(s0,(s0 = s1 → s0 = hs0)), hs0 = s1)
  ax6ev(hs0, s1)
  alrimiv(s0, hs0 = s1, (s0 = s1 → s0 = hs0))
  equeuclr(hs0, s1, s0)
  eu3v(s0, hs0, s0 = s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(s0 = s1)
}

thm nfeud2OLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1) {

  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| wi(wa(w0, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wnf(s0, w1))
} = {
  nfxfrd(s0, w0, weu(s1, w1), wex(hs0, wal(s1, wb(w1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  eu6(s1, hs0, w1)
  nfexd(s0, hs0, w0, wal(s1, wb(w1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  nfald2(s0, s1, w0, wb(w1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  nfbid(s0, wa(w0, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), w1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  adantl(w0, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wnf(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  nfeqf1(s0, s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)

}

thm nfeud2OLD(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ (w0 → F/(s0, ∃!(s1, w1)))
  ⊣ F/(s1, w0)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ ¬ ∀(s0, s0 = s1))→ F/(s0, w1))
} = {
  nfxfrd(s0, w0, ∃!(s1, w1), ∃(hs0, ∀(s1,(w1 ↔ s1 = hs0))))
  eu6(s1, hs0, w1)
  nfexd(s0, hs0, w0, ∀(s1,(w1 ↔ s1 = hs0)))
  nfv(hs0, w0)
  nfald2(s0, s1, w0, (w1 ↔ s1 = hs0))
  nfbid(s0, (w0 ∧ ¬ ∀(s0, s0 = s1)), w1, s1 = hs0)

  nfeqf1(s0, s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(w1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: sb8eulem
blocks.content: Lemma. Factor out the common proof skeleton of ~ sb8euv and ~ sb8eu . Variable substitution in unique existential quantifier. (Contributed by NM, 7-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Oct-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 24-Aug-2019.) Factor out common proof lines. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 9-Feb-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm sb8eulem(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  |- wb(weu(s0, w0), weu(s1, wsb(s1, s0, w0)))
  -| wnf(s1, wsb(s2, s0, w0))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wb(wsb(s2, s0, w0), wsb(s1, s0, w0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  3bitr4i(weu(s0, w0), weu(s1, wsb(s1, s0, w0)), wex(hs0, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))), wex(hs0, wal(s1, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))))
  exbii(hs0, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wal(s1, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))))
  3bitri(wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wal(s1, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))), wal(s2, wsb(s2, s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))), wal(s2, wb(wsb(s2, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))
  sb8v(s0, s2, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  nfv(s2, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  albii(s2, wsb(s2, s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wb(wsb(s2, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))
  sblbis(s2, s0, w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  equsb3(s2, s0, hs0)
  cbvalv1(s2, s1, wb(wsb(s2, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))), wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  nfbi(s1, wsb(s2, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  nfv(s1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  nfv(s2, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0))))
  bibi12d(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wsb(s2, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)), wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  equequ1(s2, s1, hs0)
  eu6(s0, hs0, w0)
  eu6(s1, hs0, wsb(s1, s0, w0))
  diff.wb.s(s2, w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s2, cv(s0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s2), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diff.wb.s(s2, wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wsb.s(s2, s1, s0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, cv(s1), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wsb(s1, s0, w0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sb8eulem(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (∃!(s0, w0)↔ ∃!(s1,[s1 / s0]w0))
  ⊣ F/(s1,[s2 / s0]w0)
  ⊣ (s2 = s1 →([s2 / s0]w0 ↔[s1 / s0]w0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  3bitr4i(∃!(s0, w0), ∃!(s1,[s1 / s0]w0), ∃(hs0, ∀(s0,(w0 ↔ s0 = hs0))), ∃(hs0, ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))))
  exbii(hs0, ∀(s0,(w0 ↔ s0 = hs0)), ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 ↔ s1 = hs0)))
  3bitri(∀(s0,(w0 ↔ s0 = hs0)), ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 ↔ s1 = hs0)), ∀(s2,[s2 / s0](w0 ↔ s0 = hs0)), ∀(s2,([s2 / s0]w0 ↔ s2 = hs0)))
  sb8v(s0, s2, (w0 ↔ s0 = hs0))
  nfv(s2, (w0 ↔ s0 = hs0))
  albii(s2, [s2 / s0](w0 ↔ s0 = hs0), ([s2 / s0]w0 ↔ s2 = hs0))
  sblbis(s2, s0, w0, s0 = hs0, s2 = hs0)
  equsb3(s2, s0, hs0)
  cbvalv1(s2, s1, ([s2 / s0]w0 ↔ s2 = hs0), ([s1 / s0]w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))
  nfbi(s1, [s2 / s0]w0, s2 = hs0)
  nfv(s1, s2 = hs0)
  nfv(s2, ([s1 / s0]w0 ↔ s1 = hs0))
  bibi12d(s2 = s1, [s2 / s0]w0, s2 = hs0, [s1 / s0]w0, s1 = hs0)
  equequ1(s2, s1, hs0)
  eu6(s0, hs0, w0)
  eu6(s1, hs0, [s1 / s0]w0)
  diff.wb.s(s2, w0, s0 = hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, s2, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diff.wb.s(s2, [s1 / s0]w0, s1 = hs0)
  diff.wsb.s(s2, s1, s0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s2, s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w([s1 / s0]w0)
}

}

thm eu1(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wb(weu(s0, w0), wex(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  -| wnf(s1, w0)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  3bitr4i(weu(s0, w0), wex(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), weu(s1, wsb(s1, s0, w0)), wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  euf(s1, s0, wsb(s1, s0, w0))
  nfs1v(s0, s1, w0)
  sb8euv(s0, s1, w0)
  exbii(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wal(s1, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  bitr4i(wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wal(s1, wb(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wa(wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s1, s0, w0)))))
  anbi12ci(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wsb(s1, s0, w0))))
  sb6rfv(s1, s0, w0)
  albii(s1, wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi2i(wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  equcom(s0, s1)
  albiim(s1, wsb(s1, s0, w0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.content: Substitution into an at-most-one quantifier. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm sbmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  |- wb(wsb(s0, s1, wmo(s2, w0)), wmo(s2, wsb(s0, s1, w0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  3bitr4i(wsb(s0, s1, wmo(s2, w0)), wmo(s2, wsb(s0, s1, w0)), wsb(s0, s1, wex(hs0, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))), wex(hs0, wal(s2, wi(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))))
  bitri(wsb(s0, s1, wex(hs0, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))), wex(hs0, wal(s2, wi(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))), wex(hs0, wsb(s0, s1, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))))
  sbex(s0, s1, hs0, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))
  exbii(hs0, wsb(s0, s1, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))), wal(s2, wi(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))))
  sbalv(s0, s1, s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))), wi(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))
  sblim(s0, s1, w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  nfv(s1, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  sbbii(s0, s1, wmo(s2, w0), wex(hs0, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0))))))
  df-mo(s2, hs0, w0)
  df-mo(s2, hs0, wsb(s0, s1, w0))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s2), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wsb(s0, s1, w0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sbmo(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ([s0 / s1]∃*(s2, w0)↔ ∃*(s2,[s0 / s1]w0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  3bitr4i([s0 / s1]∃*(s2, w0), ∃*(s2,[s0 / s1]w0), [s0 / s1]∃(hs0, ∀(s2,(w0 → s2 = hs0))), ∃(hs0, ∀(s2,([s0 / s1]w0 → s2 = hs0))))
  bitri([s0 / s1]∃(hs0, ∀(s2,(w0 → s2 = hs0))), ∃(hs0, ∀(s2,([s0 / s1]w0 → s2 = hs0))), ∃(hs0,[s0 / s1]∀(s2,(w0 → s2 = hs0))))
  sbex(s0, s1, hs0, ∀(s2,(w0 → s2 = hs0)))
  exbii(hs0, [s0 / s1]∀(s2,(w0 → s2 = hs0)), ∀(s2,([s0 / s1]w0 → s2 = hs0)))
  sbalv(s0, s1, s2, (w0 → s2 = hs0), ([s0 / s1]w0 → s2 = hs0))
  sblim(s0, s1, w0, s2 = hs0)
  nfv(s1, s2 = hs0)

blocks.name: eupick
blocks.content: Existential uniqueness "picks" a variable value for which another wff is true. If there is only one thing ` x ` such that ` ph ` is true, and there is also an ` x ` (actually the same one) such that ` ph ` and ` ps ` are both true, then ` ph ` implies ` ps ` regardless of ` x ` . This theorem can be useful for eliminating existential quantifiers in a hypothesis. Compare Theorem *14.26 in [WhiteheadRussell] p. 192. (Contributed by NM, 10-Jul-1994.)

blocks.name: 2eu4
blocks.content: This theorem provides us with a definition of double existential uniqueness ("exactly one ` x ` and exactly one ` y ` "). Naively one might think (incorrectly) that it could be defined by ` E! x E! y ph ` . See ~ 2eu1 for a condition under which the naive definition holds and ~ 2exeu for a one-way implication. See ~ 2eu5 and ~ 2eu8 for alternate definitions. (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2001.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 14-Sep-2019.)

blocks.name: 2eu5
blocks.content: An alternate definition of double existential uniqueness (see ~ 2eu4 ). A mistake sometimes made in the literature is to use ` E! x E! y ` to mean "exactly one ` x ` and exactly one ` y ` ". (For example, see Proposition 7.53 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 53.) It turns out that this is actually a weaker assertion, as can be seen by expanding out the formal definitions. This theorem shows that the erroneous definition can be repaired by conjoining ` A. x E* y ph ` as an additional condition. The correct definition apparently has never been published ( ` E* ` means "exists at most one"). (Contributed by NM, 26-Oct-2003.)

  euan(s0, weu(s1, wex(s0, w0)), wex(s1, w0))
  nfeu(s0, s1, wex(s0, w0))
  nfe1(s0, w0)
  eubii(s0, weu(s1, wa(wex(s0, w0), wex(s1, w0))), wa(weu(s1, wex(s0, w0)), wex(s1, w0)))
  3bitri(weu(s1, wa(wex(s0, w0), wex(s1, w0))), wa(weu(s1, wex(s0, w0)), wex(s1, w0)), weu(s1, wa(wex(s1, w0), wex(s0, w0))), wa(wex(s1, w0), weu(s1, wex(s0, w0))))

blocks.name: 2eu8

  euan(s0, weu(s1, weu(s0, w0)), wex(s1, w0))
  nfeu(s0, s1, weu(s0, w0))
  nfeu1(s0, w0)

blocks.name: euae
blocks.content: Two ways to express "exactly one thing exists". To paraphrase the statement and explain the label: there Exists a Unique thing if and only if for All ` x ` , ` x ` Equals some given (and disjoint) ` y ` . Both sides are false in set theory, see theorems ~ neutru and ~ dtru . (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2004.) State the theorem using truth constant ` T. ` . (Revised by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.) Reduce axiom dependencies. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 2-Mar-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm euae(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wb(weu(s0, wtru), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  3bitr4ri(weu(s0, wtru), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(wtru, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wa(wex(s0, wtru), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(wtru, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  biantrur(wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(wtru, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wex(s0, wtru))
  extru(s0)
  bitri(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wex(s1, wal(s0, wi(wtru, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wex(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  impbii(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wex(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  19.8w(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  hbaev(s0, s1, s1)
  con4i(wex(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  sylib(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wex(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  hbnaev(s0, s1, s1)
  alnex(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  exbii(s1, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wi(wtru, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  albii(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wtru, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  trut(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  eu3v(s0, s1, wtru)
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: exists1
blocks.content: Two ways to express "exactly one thing exists". The left-hand side requires only one variable to express this. Both sides are false in set theory, see theorem ~ dtru . (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2004.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 7-Oct-2022.)

  3imtr4g(wex(s0, w0), weu(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0))), wn(wex(s0, wn(w0))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wal(s0, w0))
